task.title: Generating a Self-Signed Certificate
task.shortdesc: You can use the Java keytool command to generate a self-signed certificate.

step.cmd: From the command line, navigate to the following directory: <SDCinstalldir>/etc.

info.note: Use the same password for the -storepass and -keypass parameters.

step.cmd: When keytool requests your first and last name, enter a fully-qualified host name as follows:
When keytool requests the name of your organizational unit, enter the name.
When keytool requests the name of your organization, enter the name.
When keytool requests the name of your city or locality, enter the name.
When keytool requests the name of your state or province, enter the name.
When keytool requests the two character country code, enter the code.
When keytool requests verification that the information is correct, enter yes if it is correct.
step.stepresult: The tool generates a self-signed certificate in the form of the sdc-keystore.jks file.

step.cmd: Enter the keystore password in the keystore password file: <SDCinstalldir>/etc/sdc-keystore-password.txt.
Save a copy of the sdc-keystore.jks and sdc-keystore-password.txt files.
